duties_responsibilities.duty: Coordinate daily oversight of administrative responsibility for the hospitalist program.
Facilitate and track key onboarding activities for new providers and team members.
Serve as a liaison between Sound and Hospital Medical Staff Office, ensuring credentialing and provider enrollment packets are complete and following up on missing documentation.
Communicate key announcements to the hospitalist team and maintain important team documents.
Coordinate monthly and quarterly meetings, both within the hospitalist team and with hospital partner leadership, including scheduling, agenda, room/material facilitation, and meeting minutes.
Manage incoming phone calls, faxes, and mail. Maintain a Master team list and hospital contacts.

Assist hospitalist team with various administrative tasks, including completing forms, maintaining client-facing materials, tracking contract renewal timelines, and gathering information for contracting support.
Develop effective relationships with hospital data owners and collaborate with Regional Operations Manager to ensure timely collection of data.
Identify and problem-solve day-to-day site operations issues related to payroll, credentialing, human resources, recruiting, etc.
Provide support for organizational Value-Based Care activities, including coordination with the hospital business office and staffing management.
Ensure accuracy and timeliness of physician shifts for payroll, as well as coordination and facilitation of onboarding/orientation requirements for Physicians and Advanced Practice Providers.

Coordinate the service line(s) team schedule with site Program Medical Director and Staffing Coordinator, with proactive 3-6 month planning, labor/staffing mix awareness, and management of critical staffing gaps.
Drive internal staffing calls, follow up on scheduling issues, and assist in staffing optimization management processes.

education_certification.credential: Associate degree in a related field
